title: I need to send books to an inmate. I am in the UK. What is the best way to do this? - Quora

response.answer_text: Order the book from W H Smiths, Foyles, Waterstone or Blackwells. These are the four main approved suppliers. If the inmate refuses the book (or it is something that is not permitted) any return/forwarding of the book will be at the inmate’s expense. As long as it comes from an approved supplier the prison will accept it although it will be examined as all property is. A convicted prisoner will be subject to volumetric controls on his/her possessions however apart from that there is no limit to the number of books a prisoner can have.

I believe that books can only be sent from a small number of approved bookshops, but my knowledge may be out-of-date. I would suggest you contact the specific prison and ask them, because they can have different rules, and the answer may also depend on the circumstances of the individual prisoner. find a prison in England and Wales
